message.content:
cs.PL, cs.CR, cs.LO, cs.SE, cs.DC 

The paper discusses the design principles of Scilla, an intermediate-level language for verified smart contracts. It focuses on the programming component of smart contracts and its formal verification, which suggests that it belongs to the Programming Languages (cs.PL) and Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-categories. The paper also mentions the automata-based model of Scilla, which relates to the Logic in Computer Science (cs.LO) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the communication aspect of smart contracts, which suggests that it may also belong to the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category. Finally, the paper mentions the compilation of Scilla from high-level languages, which relates to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category.
